com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.security

Class EMXSigner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.security.EMXSigner

  • public final class EMXSigner
extends Object
    Class that privately reformats an EMX FIX message data string into a form that is suitable for signing and verifying, and provides methods for performing that signing and verification.

    The EMXSigner is fully independent of any particular FIX engine.

    To sign a message, first call the EMXSigner constructor passing the PrivateKey and Certificate. The EMXSigner object can be used many times once constructed. When there is a message to sign, call the setSignatureTime() and setMessage() methods. Now the client application can call the getSignatureTime() and getSignature() methods to obtain the values for these two fields that the client program must add to the FIX message.

    To verify a message, use an EMXSigner constructed from either constructor. When there is a message to verify, call the setMessage() method and then call verify().

    Author:
    Christopher J Burton, 26/Nov/2001.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  EMXSigner.CertificateManager
      This interface defines how a certificate can be made available to the EMXSigner for verifying a message against its PKCS#7 signature.
      static class  EMXSigner.CertificateNotFoundException
      An EMXSigner.CertificateNotFoundException is thrown if no certificate can be found with the supplied IssuerDN and SerialNumber when a verify() is being carried out.
      static class  EMXSigner.MessageFormatException
      An EMXSigner.MessageFormatException is thrown if a message supplied to sign() or verify() is badly formed or cannot be parsed.
      static class  EMXSigner.VerifyFailureException
      An EMXSigner.VerifyFailureException is thrown if the signature on the message supplied to verify() does not match that generated by the certificate that is being used.

      Create an EMXSigner that is suitable only for verifying a message.
      EMXSigner(PrivateKey privateKey, X509Certificate certificate)
      Create an EMXSigner that is suitable for signing or verifying a message.

    • Method Detail

      • setCertificateManager

        public void setCertificateManager(EMXSigner.CertificateManager certificateManager)
        Set the CertificateManager that will return the certificate against which a signature will be verified. This method must be called when a message is to be verified against a certificate that will be determined from the contents of its PKCS#7 signature field. The CertificateManager object must know how to obtain the certificate that matches a given CA distinguished name and serial number.
        Parameters:
        certificateManager - the certificate manager to set

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(byte[] message)
        Set the FIX message that is to be signed or verified.
        Parameters:
        message - the FIX message that is to be signed or verified

      • setSignatureTime

        public void setSignatureTime()
        Set the signature time to that of the Date supplied. The time string generated uses the Fix format of "YYYYMMDD-HH:MM:SS".

        The setSignatureTime() method should be called before signing a message. The value allocated may be read by the user with getSignatureTime(). This allows the user to add the signature time to his message before signing it. If the message does not include a signature time, the sign() method will include the signature time after all other fields. The user will still need to add the signature time to his message before sending it.

      • setSignatureTime

        public void setSignatureTime(Date date)
        Set the signature time to a value supplied by the user.
        Parameters:
        date - The signature time that is to be assigned for this message.

      • getSignatureTime

        public String getSignatureTime()
        Return the signature time if it has been set, or null otherwise. It uses the Fix format of "YYYYMMDD-HH:MM:SS".
        Returns:
        A string in the Fix format of "YYYYMMDD-HH:MM:SS" representing the time at which it was signed, or null if the signature time has not been set or the message was not signed.

      • getSignature

        public String getSignature()
                    throws EMXSigner.MessageFormatException
        Returns:
        the signature, in the following tilde-delimited format: Signature version number: 1.0 or 3.0 Digest algorithm: SHA-1 (for 1024 key lenght) or SHA-256 (for 2048 key length) Encryption algorithm: RSA Issuer distinguished name: (eg) O=..., OU=..., CN=..., C=GB Issuer serial number, in hex: (eg) af123456 Signed digest, in hex: (eg) a23f58f...23dc
        Throws:
        EMXSigner.MessageFormatException - TBD

            throws EMXSigner.MessageFormatException,

        Verify the message that has been set with setMessage(), using the certificate that has been selected by the CertificateManager.
